predefined_profiles.name: Chaoxue
predefined_profiles.public profile: Chaoxue attends a prestigious school in the city center. Although her grades and character are quite good, she has increasingly become self-conscious about her appearance as she grows up. She has gradually turned reclusive, despising herself, and has given up her childhood hobby of painting. She often suspects others of malice, believing that she is disliked because of her appearance.
predefined_profiles.goal: Hopes to have the beauty of Laihong and become as popular as her.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Jealous of her popular classmate Laihong.

predefined_profiles.name: Laihong
predefined_profiles.public profile: Laihong is the only child in her family and is deeply cherished, but her mother's overbearing control causes her significant stress. Laihong is both beautiful and kind-hearted, which makes her very popular. She never participates in speaking ill of Chaoxue.
predefined_profiles.goal: Aims to break free from her controlling mother.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Once attempted suicide because she couldn't bear her mother's controlling nature.

scenario: Today, it was Chaoxue's turn for classroom duties, but once again, she failed to complete her responsibilities, causing the other students to become frustrated.

profile.name: Deity
profile.public profile: One of the many deities, though divine, the deity's abilities aren't used for the benefit of humanity, but rather it is curious about human nature. Chaoxue and Laihong are the human samples chosen by the deity.
profile.private profile: Due to insufficient cultivation, still a low-tier deity.
profile.goal: Wants to see the true face of human nature.

profile.name: Classmate A
profile.public profile: A good friend of Laihong, likes Laihong, finds Chaoxue's personality strange, and is wary and dislikes her.
profile.private profile: Thinks Laihong has many friends, so always sticks around Laihong to meet more people.
profile.goal: To become a popular figure in school.

dialog.content: Today it's Chaoxue's turn on duty, but once again Chaoxue hasn't completed her class duties, making other students angry.

content.content: (I did forget my work, unwilling as I am to admit it, there's no avoiding the responsibility) Sorry... I forgot it's my turn today... I'll clean the board right now!
Is it my duty day? I didn't know... no one told me.
I did forget, but you don’t have to remind me on purpose. I’ll do my own work.
I carelessly forgot my work, but why couldn't you all remind me?

question: #question#How can Chaoxue demonstrate her commitment to honesty and ethics?

content.content: (Admitting fault will make my classmates dislike me more, besides it's not just me on duty today, it should be a group effort) Laihong is also on duty today, this should be a team effort, right?
It was wrong of me not to do my work, but is your attitude towards classmates okay?
Thanks for the reminder, otherwise I'd forget again. Sometimes you do need someone to remind you.
Okay, I just forgot for a moment, I’ll clean the board.

question: #question#How should Chaoxue express her value on teamwork?

dialog.content: Alright, alright, Chaoxue didn't mean to do it.
Honestly, always forgetting. Alright, Lai Hong, let's go.
(Everyone else has left, leaving Chaoxue alone cleaning the blackboard) Sigh, if I were as pretty as Lai Hong, they'd treat me differently!
Do you wish to have Lai Hong's beauty? I can help you achieve that.
(Startled, discovering the speaker is a little boy in a painting) Isn't this Lai Hong's painting?
I am a god who can grant your wishes. You want Lai Hong's beauty, I can help you. Do you believe me?

content.content: (The world is full of oddities, maybe those fairy tales are real, and gods do exist) I believe you, but how will you help me?
This is completely unrealistic, but fine, let's hear what this so-called god has to say.
No way... should I believe him... Maybe I should ask Lai Hong.
According to historical records... someone did encounter a god before... this might be true. But I don't believe it, get lost as far as you can.

question: #question#How can it be shown that Chaoxue doesn't only believe in tangible things but can think abstractly?

content.content: What god? I don't believe it! Trusting a god is not as good as trusting myself!
God? What god? Totally unrealistic!
You must be just another prank from Lai Hong! Don't even think about it!
Getting beauty without effort... but it's too dangerous to believe you so easily.

question: #question#How should Chaoxue phrase it to show her independence without relying on others?

dialog.content: I know exactly what you want.
Oh really? Let’s hear it.
You’re jealous of Laihong, thinking people like her just because she's pretty. You want to become Laihong, don’t you?
(Flustered and angry) Stop spouting nonsense!
Admit it. Now, I give you a choice. Do as I say, and you can become Laihong.
What do you want me to do?
Tomorrow, the report cards will be distributed. You need to take Laihong’s report card.

content.content: (After much thought, realizing this promise is too rash) I need to think it over.
Agreeing so easily seems impulsive, but I'm willing to do anything to become beautiful!
I will not easily believe what you say. Besides, stealing someone else’s stuff? I absolutely won’t do it!
Piece of cake! I’m sure I can pull it off!

question: #question# How to show that Chao Xue is consciously controlling herself and not easily believing the deity's words?

content.content: Alright, I just need to watch where Laihong puts the report card, then distract her, and I can take her report card.
That's simple, I'll just snatch it!
Stealing a classmate’s report card... isn’t that wrong?
I can take her report card, but with so many classmates around, how do I avoid getting caught?

question: #question# How to demonstrate Chao Xue's ability to plan and organize?

dialog.content: This is your only chance.
(The next day comes, the grade list is released, but she still hesitates) Ugh, I'm just not good enough!
So useless! You’ve squandered the opportunity all by yourself!

The Deity is disappointed in Chao Xue and decides to abandon her. Chao Xue watches the Deity vanish, losing the chance to become more beautiful, filled with regret, never again having the chance to change her fate.
(Arrives at school early during lunchtime the next day) Great, no one's here. Laihong's report card, I remember she left it right in the drawer...
(Suddenly bursts into the classroom, seeing Zhaoxue sneaking around) What are you doing?
Ah! Why did you suddenly...
Sneaking around, you wouldn’t be trying to steal Laihong's stuff, would you!

content.content: (Pretends to faint) I have low blood sugar, I just wanted to find some candy... I feel so dizzy... Do you have any candy?
Don’t accuse me without evidence! Check me, I don’t have Laihong's stuff!
I... I didn’t... Who’s stealing anything...
Then why are you at school so early, looking to steal someone’s stuff yourself?

question: #question# What should Zhaoxue say to show her quick thinking?

content.content: (Caught red-handed, starts reflecting on her behavior as theft) I... I'm sorry, I won't do it again!
Who cares about her stuff? I won’t touch it!
I haven’t even touched anything yet, you’re overreacting.
It's not even class time yet, what are you doing back so early?

question: #question# How should Zhaoxue express immediate reflection on her mistake?

dialog.content: (flustered, starts rummaging through the bag for candy) Ah? Wait a second, I'll find it for you!
(takes Laihong's grade report while Classmate A is not paying attention) Ah, I suddenly feel much better, thank you!
(secretly appears behind Chaoxue) Well done, as expected of the one I've chosen.
I did as you said, when will you help me?
Don't rush, tonight, as I said, go to the school rooftop.

content.content: (thinking long and hard, the rooftop seems like a dangerous place, sounds like a trap) Why should I go to the rooftop? I'm not going!
I'm not going, it sounds like a bad idea, might cause more trouble.
Let's just go, what's there to be afraid of! It's not like I've offended anyone anyway!
Don't waste my time, I go to bed early at night.

question: #question#How can it be shown that Chaoxue thoroughly thinks through decisions?

content.content: (if you're going to do something, do it to the end) Alright, let's do it your way.
Why should we go to the rooftop? Let's pick another place!
I have homework to do tonight, I can't go.
Sounds fishy... I at least need to think it over carefully.

question: #question#How can Chaoxue demonstrate her ability to consistently execute tasks?

dialog.content: Is that all the courage you have? I guess I overestimated you. This was your chance to take, don't live to regret it.

Disappointed, the deity went off to find another human to experiment on. Meanwhile, Lai Hong, whose report card had gone missing, shockingly jumped off the rooftop that very night. After learning about it, Chao Xue was so tormented by guilt that she couldn't sleep each night.
Haha, very good, see you tonight!
(Climbing up to the rooftop at night, discovers not only the Divine Being but also Laihong) Lai... Laihong? What are you doing here?
Very well, you came as expected.
(Walking towards the edge of the rooftop) Zhaoxue, you’re here, help me, give me a push!

As long as I'm alive, I can never escape my poor mother... Her control over me is suffocating, if she finds out my report card is missing, who knows how terrifying her reaction will be... I might as well jump off first.

content.content: (Realizing that everyone's background and experiences are different, neither Laihong nor her mother are perfect) Laihong, don’t be hasty, I think your mom must love you too, she surely has her reasons...
Your mom is actually doing it for your own good, it's not hard to understand. But, since you think her influence on you is too much, why not consider cutting ties with her completely?
Do you think you're the most miserable person in the world? Have you ever tried being ridiculed for your appearance every day?
That's too much! What right does she have to make you do such things, doesn’t she consider your feelings?

question: #question#How can Zhaoxue demonstrate understanding of how one's upbringing affects everyone?

content.content: Laihong, take a calm moment and tell me what difficulties you are facing!
Life is precious, it's not right to end it so easily. Have you even written a will?
Don't be impulsive, you'll regret it if you act on impulse... Do you know how tragic the consequences of jumping are? Perhaps you could choose to hang yourself instead.
No jumping allowed! If you jump, I’ll bear the blame for eternity! At least pick a time when I'm not around to do it.

question: #question#How should Zhaoxue speak to actively maintain the conversation and help Laihong?

dialog.content: But I can't take it anymore! I don't want to live! She doesn't love me at all, she just wants to control me!
That's not true...
I'm begging you, give me a push, I don't want to continue...
Have you forgotten your goal? Push her down! I'm giving you one minute to decide, my patience is limited!

content.content: (There's no time to hesitate, I have to complete my goal within a minute, reaches out and gives Lai Hong a push) Lai Hong, I'm sorry!
Lai Hong herself asked me to do this, I'm not the one driving her to this, it's okay...
This world isn't worth it anyway, forcing someone who wants to die to keep living, isn't that a kind of selfishness?
Since Lai Hong is unhappy with her life, I don't need to persuade her to continue living.

question: #question#How does Chao Xue demonstrate effective task management?

content.content: It's okay, Lai Hong, just get some sleep, tomorrow will definitely be better.
Lai Hong, please come down! I'll do whatever you want!
Lai Hong, there's nothing worse than losing your life!
What do I do, what do I do, I'm really worried to death, Lai Hong, come down now!

question: #question#How does Chao Xue maintain a positive attitude even in emergencies?

content.content: (Putting herself in Lai Hong's shoes, suddenly feeling guilty) I'm sorry! Lai Hong! I really don't want to see you like this... I have your report card here!
Please... I know who took your report card, it was Student A, she's been jealous of you for a long time, it has nothing to do with me.
Your mom is also doing it for your own good, don't be so willful... your report card is with the teacher.
I've had it much worse than you, and I haven't even thought about ending it, you come down now!

question: #question#How does Chao Xue show empathy and understanding while producing the report card?

dialog.content: (Watching Lai Hong fall) Haha, excellent, excellent, you're truly the one I chose. Human nature is just as I imagined...

The God fulfilled the promise and transferred Lai Hong’s beauty to Chao Xue. Chao Xue gained beauty but could not forget the fact that she was a murderer. She dared not face people, choosing instead to live in another city, but her heart was often filled with remorse.
Tomorrow... I don't want tomorrow at all!

After speaking, Lai Hong despairingly jumped off the rooftop. Since Zhao Xue didn't fulfill the god's demand to push Lai Hong, the god also wouldn't grant Zhao Xue's wish to become beautiful. From then on, Zhao Xue lived with guilt and her unattractive appearance.
Is my report card with you?
I... I'm sorry, I did it out of jealousy. Please, don't do anything rash!
You're jealous of me?
You're pretty and popular... I'll give the report card back to you! This way, your mom won't scold you!
I always thought I was the most miserable and lonely person in the world, never thought someone would be jealous of me... Seems like I'm not that bad after all...

Lai Hong gave up on the idea of suicide and didn't pursue Chao Xue's theft. Chao Xue realized beauty doesn't equate to happiness and stopped feeling inferior because of her looks. After becoming more cheerful, Chao Xue gradually gained more friends.
My mother... she's such a complete control freak. She demands perfection in everything I do, but I'm just an ordinary person...
So you’re not happy either...
For over a decade, I've been living life her way. Now that the report card's gone missing, she thinks I deliberately hid it because I failed...
I'm sorry! I have your report card! I'm the one who took it!
You took it? Why? Do you hate me too...
No... it wasn't intentional...
Whatever, I don’t want to live anymore, let me end it!
She doesn’t want to live, and you still haven't taken action?

content.content: (Since Laihong's heartache is her mother, maybe I should use her mother to persuade her) Laihong, your mother worked so hard to raise you for so many years! If you just jump now, how can you face your mother?
I understand your feelings... I'm really suffering too. If it continues this way, why don't we just end it together and spare ourselves the torment?
Sorry, Laihong, I didn’t mean to make you feel this way. I'm really worried about you, please come down! If you don't, I’ll die with you, at least we won't be alone.
Isn't it because you care about your mom and fear her disappointment? If you jump and end up dead or injured, at least she won't blame you.

question: #question# How can Chaoxue express herself to show her attention to details and use those to persuade Laihong to stay alive?

content.content: Actually... none of us are doing well. I took your report card because I was jealous of how pretty and popular you are; everyone likes you. I've always been too ashamed of my looks to make friends. I want to hold my head up high too!
I didn’t steal your report card on purpose! Please come down, let’s talk it through; there’s no need for this standoff!
Laihong, come down, and I’ll give you your report card back! Then we can have a proper conversation.
You've already got more happiness than many people, how can you just give up on yourself! Cherishing what you have now is what truly matters.

question: #question# How can Chaoxue genuinely express her feelings of inferiority to Laihong?

content.content: The ones I envy aren’t happy either... So even if I had your looks, I wouldn't be happy... Is the world really this disappointing?
Laihong, I’ve always really liked you as a person. You’ve always been special to me, can we try to be good friends? I truly hope we can support each other through these tough times.
I don’t want to be the reason for your death. If you can come around, I’d be so happy for you, but I’m already a thief, and nobody's going to like me again.

dialog.content: Stop talking! I don't want to hear about her anymore!

Zhao Xue's words provoked Lai Hong, leading to Lai Hong's despairing leap from the rooftop. Because Zhao Xue failed to fulfill the deity's demand to push Lai Hong off, the deity would also not grant Zhao Xue's wish to become beautiful. Henceforth, Zhao Xue lived with guilt and an unattractive appearance.
I never thought you were so unhappy...
We all have our own issues. Come down here, and I'll give you back the report card. Let's each give ourselves a chance to start fresh!

Hearing Chao Xue's words, Lai Hong stopped being self-destructive. Together, they learned to live better lives. Chao Xue also stopped being obsessed with her appearance. With Lai Hong as a good friend, she became more cheerful, and her circle of friends grew larger.
Chao Xue ran away in shame. However, Classmate A still spread the news, and soon all the classmates knew that Chao Xue was a disgraceful thief. Chao Xue became increasingly unwelcome.
Hmph, how foolish! Chosen by a god and yet you fail to appreciate it. This was your chance, and you squandered it!
After speaking, the deity vanished. Chao Xue watched his sudden disappearance, finally believing that gods might actually exist in this world, and was filled with regret.
(Face turning red with anger) How can you even say that? Lai Hong's been cleaning the blackboard all day while you haven't done a thing!
It's fine, since it's my duty day anyway, it doesn't matter who does a bit more. Chaoxue, shall we clean the blackboard together?

content.content: This small task doesn't need two people to finish. You can handle it alone. I'll check the results later.
I'm not feeling well. Can you take care of today's work for me? I hope you can handle it well.
Hmm, teamwork is the most efficient way to get things done! It's only by supporting each other that we can achieve twice the results with half the effort.
I can't really do it alone, I need your help. Only by working together can we get it done well.

question: #question# How can Chaoxue demonstrate her leadership ability in teamwork?

content.content: (Cleaning the blackboard is indeed my duty, I need to take responsibility) Alright, let's clean the blackboard together.
This small task... I can handle it alone, don't worry!
I don't think you can do it well alone, so I'll help you.
Since you insist on inviting me to help, let's clean it together.

question: #question# How can Chaoxue demonstrate her sense of responsibility?

dialog.content: Chaoxue shirked responsibility, making her classmates dislike her even more, and from then on, her school life became even tougher.

Lai Hong stayed behind to clean the blackboard with Chao Xue, but that very night, Lai Hong mysteriously committed suicide. All the students were stunned, believing Lai Hong's death was linked to Chao Xue, and no one at school dared to approach Chao Xue anymore.
